statement.tex: %text Consider the binary operations $*:\mathbb{R}\times\mathbb{R}\rightarrow\mathbb{R}$ and $o:\mathbb{R}\times\mathbb{R}\rightarrow\mathbb{R}$ defined as $a*b=|a-b|$ and $a\,o\,b=a$ for all $a,b\in \mathbb{R}$. Show that '$*$' is commutative but not associative, and '$o$' is associative but not commutative. %

step.context: %text Would the following prove that the binary operator '$*$' is not associative (answer and then confirm using an example)? %
step.reason: %text By definition of associativity, binary operator '$*$' is associative if $a*(b*c)= (a*b)*c$ for any $a,b,c\in \mathbb{R}$. Let us verify that '$*$' is not associative using an example where $a=1$, $b=2$ and $c=3$. % \qquad\begin{align} a*(b*c) &= |a-|b-c|| \\ &= |1-|2-3||=0 \\ (a*b)*c &= ||a-b|-c| \\ &= ||1-2|-3| = 2 \end{align} \\ %text Therefore '$*$' is not associative. %

step.context: %text Would the following prove that the binary operator '$o$' is not commutative (answer and then confirm using an example)? %
step.reason: %text By definition of commutativity, binary operator '$o$' is commutative if $a\,o\,b=b\,o\,a$ for any $a,b\in \mathbb{R}$. Let us verify that '$o$' is not associative using an example where $a=1$ and $b=2$. % \qquad\begin{align} a\,o\,b &= a = 1 \\ b\,o\,a &= b = 2 \end{align} \\ %text Therefore binary operator '$o$' is not commutative. %

step.context: %text Does the following prove that binary operator '$*$' is commutative? %
step.reason: %text To prove operator '$*$' is commutative, we need to show that $a*b=b*a$. % \begin{align} a*b&=|a-b| \\ b*a&=|b-a| \\ |a-b|&=|b-a|\implies a*b=b*a \end{align} \\ %text Therefore binary operator '$*$'' is commutative. %

step.context: %text Does the following prove that binary operator '$o$' is associative? %
step.reason: %text To prove operator '$o$' is associative, we need to show that $a\,o\,(b\,o\,c)=(a\,o\,b)\, c$. % \begin{align} a\,o\,(b\,o\,c)&=a\,o\,b=a \\ (a\,o\,b)\,o\, c&=a\,o\,c=a \\ a&=a\implies a\,o\,(b\,o\,c)=(a\,o\,b)\,o\, c \end{align}\\ %text Therefore binary operator '$o$'' is associative. %
